    3: namespace Symbiotatk\Symbtk\File\Model\Html;
    4:
    5: use Symbiotatk\Symbtk AS Main;
    6: use Symbiotatk\Symbtk\File AS File;
    7: use Symbiotatk\Symbtk\Model AS Model;
    8:
    9: /** DOMDocument append a node
    10: * @param String $html
    11: * @param \DOMElement $node
    12: * @param String $parent [ 'head', 'title', 'body', 'id:id_name' ]
    13: * @return String $html
    14: */
    15: function Append(String $html, \DOMElement $node, String $parent) {
    16: $doc = load_from_string($html);
    17: $node = $doc->importNode($node, true);
    18: $docElement = find_doc_element($doc, $parent);
    19: if ($docElement) {
    20: $docElement->appendChild($node);
    21: }
    22:
    23: return doc_to_string($doc);
    24: }
    25:
    26: /** DOMDocument create document or node.
    27: * @param String $tag
    28: * @param Object $attributes
    29: * @param Array $children If nodes are improper, an error will be returned. (ie. &lt;h1&gt; containing another tag)
    30: * @return Mixed $html|$node If no args provided, creates basic document. Returns HTML as string. With args provided, a DOMElement is returned.
    31: */
    32: function Create(String $tag=NULL, Object $attributes=NULL, Array $children=NULL) {
    33: if ($tag) {
    34: return create_tag($tag, $attributes, $children);
    35: }
    36: $doc = basic_template();
    37: $render = doc_to_string($doc);
    38: return '<!DOCTYPE html>' . "\n" . $render;
    39: }
    40:
    41: function Replace(String $html, \DOMElement $node, String $parent) {
    42: $doc = load_from_string($html);
    43: $node = $doc->importNode($node, true);
    44: $docElement = find_doc_element($doc, $parent);
    45: if ($docElement) {
    46: $existing = $docElement->childNodes;
    47: while ($existing->length > 0) {
    48: $docElement->removeChild($existing->item(0));
    49: }
    50:
    51: $docElement->appendChild($node);
    52: }
    53: return doc_to_string($doc);
    54: }
    55:
    56: /** Basic DOMDocument [complete HTML]
    57: * @return \DOMDocument $doc
    58: */
    59: function basic_template() {
    60: $rcsite = Model\RcSite\Load();
    61:
    62: $doc = new \DOMDocument('1.0','UTF-8');
    63: $doc->preserveWhiteSpace = false;
    64: $html = $doc->createElement('html');
    65: $html->setAttribute('lang', 'en');
    66:
    67: $head = $doc->createElement('head');
    68: $title = $doc->createElement('title');
    69: $title->nodeValue = (property_exists($rcsite, 'SiteName'))
    70: ? $rcsite->SiteName
    71: : ucfirst(Main\APP_ID);
    72: $meta = $doc->createElement('meta');
    73: $meta->setAttribute('content', 'width=device-width, initial-scale=1, maximum-scale=1, user-scalable=no');
    74: $meta->setAttribute('name', 'viewport');
    75: $head->appendChild($title);
    76: $head->appendChild($meta);
    77:
    78: $meta = $doc->createElement('meta');
    79: $meta->setAttribute('http-equiv', 'Content-Security-Policy');
    80: $meta->setAttribute('content', "default-src 'self'; img-src https://*; child-src 'none';");
    81: // $head->appendChild($meta);
    82:
    83: $body = $doc->createElement('body');
    84:
    85: $html->appendChild($head);
    86: $html->appendChild($body);
    87: $doc->appendChild($html);
    88:
    89: return $doc;
    90: }
    91:
    92: /** Count node children
    93: * @param String $html
    94: * @param String $parent (html, head, title, body, 'id:id_name')
    95: * @return Integer $count
    96: */
    97: function children_count (String $html, String $parent, Int $index=0) {
    98: $doc = load_from_string($html);
    99: $ele = find_doc_element($doc, $parent, $index);
    100:
    101: $no_text_nodes = (in_array($parent, ['html', 'head']))
    102: ? true
    103: : false;
    104: $count = -1;
    105:
    106: if ($ele && property_exists($ele,'childNodes')) {
    107: $count = 0;
    108: foreach($ele->childNodes AS $node) {
    109: if ($no_text_nodes) {
    110: if (!($node instanceof \DOMText))
    111: $count++;
    112: } else {
    113: $count++;
    114: }
    115: }
    116: }
    117:
    118: return $count;
    119: }
    120:
    121: /** Create document tag node
    122: * @param String $tag
    123: * @param Object $attributes
    124: * @param Array $children
    125: * @return \DOMElement $node
    126: */
    127: function create_tag (String $tag, Object $attributes=NULL, Array $children=NULL) {
    128: $doc = new \DOMDocument;
    129: $node = create_tag_attributes($doc->createElement($tag), $attributes);
    130: $node = create_tag_children($doc, $node, $children);
    131: return $node;
    132: }
    133:
    134: /** Assign attributes to node
    135: * @param \DOMElement $node
    136: * @param Object $attributes
    137: * @return \DOMElement $node
    138: */
    139: function create_tag_attributes(\DOMElement $node, Object $attributes=NULL) {
    140: if ($attributes) {
    141: array_map(function ($k) use ($node, $attributes){
    142: $node->setAttribute($k, $attributes->$k);
    143: }, array_keys((array) $attributes));
    144: }
    145: return $node;
    146: }
    147:
    148: /** Assign children to node
    149: * @param \DOMDocument $doc
    150: * @param \DOMElement $node
    151: * @param Array $children May contain String and \DOMElement
    152: * @return \DOMElement $node
    153: */
    154: function create_tag_children(\DOMDocument $doc, \DOMElement $node, Array $children=NULL) {
    155: if ($children) {
    156: array_map(function ($i) use ($doc, $node, $children) {
    157: if ($children[$i] instanceof \DOMElement) {
    158: $child = $doc->importNode($children[$i], true);
    159: $node->appendChild($child);
    160: } elseif (is_string($children[$i])) {
    161: if (Model\String\is_html($children[$i])) {
    162: $insert = new \DOMDocument();
    163: $insert->loadHTML($children[$i]);
    164: $node->appendChild($doc->importNode($insert->documentElement, true));
    165: } else {
    166: $text = $doc->createTextNode($children[$i]);
    167: $node->appendChild($text);
    168: }
    169: }
    170: }, array_keys($children));
    171: }
    172: return $node;
    173: }
    174:
    175: /** \DOMDocument to String
    176: * @param \DOMDocument $doc
    177: * @return String $html
    178: */
    179: function doc_to_string(\DOMDocument $doc) {
    180: $doc->formatOutput = true;
    181: return $doc->saveHTML();
    182: }
    183:
    184: /** Find DOMElement by class name.
    185: * @param \DOMDocument $doc
    186: * @param String $name Class name
    187: * @param String $tag [optional] limit by tag name
    188: * @return Array $matched
    189: */
    190: function find_by_class (\DOMDocument $doc, String $name, String $tag=NULL) {
    191: if($tag){
    192: $elements = $doc->getElementsByTagName($tag);
    193: }else {
    194: $elements = $doc->getElementsByTagName("*");
    195: }
    196: $matched = array();
    197: for($i=0;$i<$elements->length;$i++) {
    198: if($elements->item($i)->attributes->getNamedItem('class')){
    199: if($elements->item($i)->attributes->getNamedItem('class')->nodeValue == $name) {
    200: $matched[]=$elements->item($i);
    201: }
    202: }
    203: }
    204: return $matched;
    205: }
    206:
    207: /** Find DOMElement by id or class name.
    208: * @param \DOMDocument $doc
    209: * @param String $name Id or Class name
    210: * @param Int $index [optional] return Array index if multiple elements found
    211: * @return \DOMElement $ele
    212: */
    213: function find_by_class_or_id (\DOMDocument $doc, String $class_or_id, Int $index=0) {
    214: $parts = explode(':', $class_or_id);
    215: $id_ns = (isset($parts[0])) ? $parts[0] : false;
    216: $value = (isset($parts[1])) ? $parts[1] : false;
    217:
    218: $class = ($id_ns && $id_ns == 'class') ? $id_ns : false;
    219: $id = ($id_ns && $id_ns == 'id') ? $id_ns : false;
    220:
    221: $ele = ($id)
    222: ? $doc->getElementById($value)
    223: : false;
    224:
    225: if ((! $ele) && ($class)) {
    226: $class_elements = find_by_class($doc, $value);
    227: $ele = (isset($class_elements[$index]))
    228: ? $class_elements[$index]
    229: : false;
    230: }
    231: return $ele;
    232: }
    233:
    234: /** Find DOMElement by tag name.
    235: * @param \DOMDocument $doc
    236: * @param String $tag Limited to 'html', 'head', 'title', 'body'
    237: * @param Int $index [optional] return Array index if multiple elements found
    238: * @return \DOMElement $ele
    239: */
    240: function find_by_tag (\DOMDocument $doc, String $tag, Int $index=0) {
    241: $valid = [ 'html', 'head', 'title', 'body' ];
    242:
    243: if (in_array($tag, $valid)) {
    244: $ele = $doc->getElementsByTagName($tag)->item($index);
    245: return $ele;
    246: }
    247: return false;
    248: }
    249:
    250: /** Find DOMElement by tag, id or class name.
    251: * @param \DOMDocument $doc
    252: * @param String $id Tag, Id or Class name
    253: * @param Int $index [optional] return Array index if multiple elements found
    254: * @return \DOMElement $ele
    255: */
    256: function find_doc_element(\DOMDocument $doc, String $id, Int $index=0) {
    257: $ele = find_by_tag($doc, $id, $index);
    258: return ($ele) ? $ele : find_by_class_or_id($doc, $id, $index);
    259: }
    260:
    261: /** String to \DOMDocument
    262: * @param String $html
    263: * @return \DOMDocument $doc
    264: */
    265: function load_from_string(String $str) {
    266: libxml_use_internal_errors(true);
    267: $doc = new \DOMDocument;
    268: $doc->preserveWhiteSpace = false;
    269: if (!$doc->loadHTML($str)) {
    270: foreach (libxml_get_errors() as $error) {
    271: // handle errors here
    272: echo var_dump($error);
    273: }
    274:
    275: libxml_clear_errors();
    276: }
    277: return $doc;
    278: }
    279:
    280: /** Alias for Create
    281: * @param String $tag
    282: * @param Mixed $attributes Accepts Array or Object
    283: * @param Mixed $children If nodes are improper, an error will be returned. (ie. &lt;h1&gt; containing another tag). Accepts String or Array.
    284: * @return Mixed $html|$node If no args provided, creates basic document. Returns HTML as string. With args provided, a DOMElement is returned.
    285: */
    286: function m(String $tag=NULL, $attributes=NULL, $children=NULL) {
    287: $attributes = (is_array($attributes))
    288: ? (object) $attributes
    289: : $attributes;
    290: $children = (is_array($children)) ? $children : [ $children ];
    291: return Create($tag, $attributes, $children);
    292: }
    293:
    294: /** Get or Set the document title
    295: * @param String $html
    296: * @param String $title If not provided, the current value will be returned. If provided the given value will be set, and the updated document will be returned.
    297: * @param Bool $append [optional] Default is true. If false, title is overwritten.
    298: * @param String $delim [optional] Title value append delimiter. Default ': '
    299: * @return String $html|$title
    300: */
    301: function title (String $html, String $title=NULL, Bool $append=true, $delim=': ') {
    302: $doc = load_from_string($html);
    303: $tag = 'title';
    304: $current = find_doc_element($doc, $tag)->nodeValue;
    305:
    306: if (! $title) {
    307: return $current;
    308: }
    309:
    310: $title = ($append) ? $current . $delim . $title : $title;
    311:
    312: find_doc_element($doc, $tag)->nodeValue = $title;
    313:
    314: return doc_to_string($doc);
    315: }
